text: The Forester's Daughter () is a 1931 German operetta film directed by Frederic Zelnik and starring Irene Eisinger, Paul Richter and Oskar Karlweis.Bock & Bergfelder p. 169 It is an adaptation of the operetta Die Försterchristl. Zelnik had previously directed a 1926 silent film version The Bohemian Dancer. The film's sets were designed by Heinz Fenchel and Jacek Rotmil. ==Cast== * Irene Eisinger as Christl Lange, known as "Försterchristl" * Paul Richter as Emperor Joseph II * Oskar Karlweis as Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart * as Corporal Franzl Földessy * Tibor Halmay as Walperl * as head Forester Lange, Christl's father * Jelly Staffel as Everl, Mozarts beloved * Adele Sandrock as Court Lady * Max Ralph-Ostermann as the Emperor's First Adjutant (as Max-Ralf Ostermann) * Hanns Waschatko as the Emperor's Second Adjutant * Gretel Berndt as Fräulein von Földessy * Louis V. Arco as Austrian Officer * Ernst Wurmser as Chef Cook at the Vienna Hofburg * Heinrich Gotho as A Notary * Alfred Frank as First Worker * Paul Hörbiger as The Old Baron * Sylvia Torf as A Peasant Woman * Rudolf Österreicher as Second Worker == References == == Bibliography == * == External links == * Category:1931 films Category:1930s historical musical films Category:German historical musical films Category:German films Category:Films of the Weimar Republic Category:German-language films Category:Films directed by Frederic Zelnik Category:Operetta films Category:Films based on operettas Category:Films set in Austria Category:Films set in the 1780s Category:Films about Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Category:Cultural depictions of Joseph II, Holy Roman Emperor Category:Films about royalty Category:Films scored by Bruno Granichstaedten Category:German black-and-white films
title: The Forester's Daughter (1931 film)
